sentence: There are 14 different analyst targets contributing to that average for Procter & Gamble Company , but the average is just that — a mathematical average.
There are analysts with lower targets than the average, including one looking for a price of $87.00.
And then on the other side of the spectrum one analyst has a target as high as $118.00.

But the whole reason to look at the average PG price target in the first place is to tap into a "wisdom of crowds" effort, putting together the contributions of all the individual minds who contributed to the ultimate number, as opposed to what just one particular expert believes.

And so with PG crossing above that average target price of $105.00/share, investors in PG have been given a good signal to spend fresh time assessing the company and deciding for themselves: is $105.00 just one stop on the way to an even higher target, or has the valuation gotten stretched to the point where it is time to think about taking some chips off the table?

The average rating presented in the last row of the above table above is from 1 to 5 where 1 is Strong Buy and 5 is Strong Sell.
